thread.title: An attempted stabbing attack was thwarted near Damascus Gate
thread.title_full: An attempted stabbing attack was thwarted near Damascus Gate

author: Nir Hasson
title: An attempted stabbing attack was thwarted near Damascus Gate
text:
An attempted stabbing attack was thwarted near Damascus Gate in East Jerusalem on Wednesday afternoon. The suspected assailant was shot dead, wounding no one.
According to preliminary reports, a Border Police unit noticed a suspicious-looking youth sitting near Damascus Gate. When they drew near, the youth drew a knife and attempted to stab them. The officers shot toward the youth, but he ran toward several police officers nearby with the knife in his hand. The Border Police officers shouted to warn them, and they shot the assailant down.
On Tuesday, four terrorist attacks in Jerusalem and Ra'anana killed three people and wounded seven, in the bloodiest morning since the escalation began.
The most serious attack on Tuesday occurred in Armon Hanatziv neighborhood in Jerusalem, where two assailants stormed a bus with a gun and a knife. The two killed two passengers and wounded ten others, including two women who were seriously wounded, before they were apprehended by police. One assailant was shot dead, and the other was seriously wounded.
Nir Hasson
Haaretz Correspondent
